result.execSummary:
The defendant Erick Jesus Monge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Letter from defendant requesting a payment plan.

Defendant Erick Jesus Monge in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  
Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Agent Linda Steiner appeared for the Department of Corrections.
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Probation Review.  Hearing proceeded.  Parties in receipt of court memo.  Statements made by defense, agent, and defendant.  The state relies on agent court memo. The Court lifts the stay on 5 days of condition time.  The Court orders the defendant to serve 5 DAYS in the House of Correction with release to attend programming.  The Court orders NO use of alcohol or illegal substances or release privileges forfeited.  The Court will schedule additional review hearings upon agent request.  Defendant taken in to custody forthwith. Filed, Letter from Renew Counseling Services, Probation Status Review.

Defendant Erick Jesus Monge in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted. Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  No condition time was imposed.  Court found that further review is needed.  If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his probation, the court may impose some additional condition time on the review date.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg. Case adjourned.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Probation review status report, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Erick Jesus Monge in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DOC agent also in court.
The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  Defendant to get enrolled in AOSA treatment.  Defendant to show agent verification of the community service completed, and employment verification.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 25 DAYS of the condition time that was stayed to today's date with huber for GED classes at the Journey House, and for Verifiable work.  Court is opposed to electronic monitoring.  Defendant taken into custody.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.
Case adjourned to 7/20/2015 at 8:30 a.m. for probation review hearing in Branch 3.  aw  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Erick Jesus Monge in court.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Dennis Murphy.  Agent also present in court.
Attorney Plaisted had a family emergency, and unable to appear.  Case adjourned for probation review hearing on 5/4/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Probation report, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Erick Jesus Monge in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DOC agent also in court.
Defendant to continue to comply with probation.  Defendant to make every appointment with agent.  Defendant to enroll in a GED or HSED program, and to go to Renew Counseling.  The Court ordered another review hearing to further monitor the defendant.  The Court ordered the stay on the condition time to continue until the next court date.  
Case adjourned to 4/27/2015 at 8:30 a.m. for probation review hearing in Branch 3.  aw  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Probation status review report, received and filed.  aw
Order commuting probation term on count 1, signed and filed.  Copy sent to state.  aw
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Clare L. Fiorenza, Br. 3, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify probation term (count one).

Defendant Erick Jesus Monge in court with attorney Michael B. Plaisted.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense, and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court sentenced defendant to serve 1 YEAR in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence.  Court gives credit for 3 days served. 
Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNT 2:
Court sentenced defendant to serve 1 YEAR in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence.  Court gives credit for 0 days served. 
Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AS TO BOTH COUNTS:

- 6 MONTHS, IMPOSED and STAYED, TO THE PROBATION REVIEW HEARING ON 1/29/2015.  DEFENDANT MUST BRING IN PROOF THAT HE WAS WORKING ON MONDAY 10/27/2014. (COUNT 1 ONLY)
 
- 120 DAYS, IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations.  Defendant shall serve 20 days for the first violation, 40 days for the second violation, and 60 days for the third violation. (120 DAYS FOR EACH COUNT)
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.  Defendant shall be tested twice per month for the first year, and then be tested once per month, randomly.  
- Must enroll in a GED or HSED program.
- Maintain full time employment, school, or a combination of both.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Complete 20 hours of community service on each count.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample (count 2 only), and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on probation, or serve 10 days in the HOC (on each count), consecutive. Cash bail to apply.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.
- Pay all supervision fees.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

CASE ADJOURNED FOR PROBATION REVIEW HEARING ON 1/29/2015 AT 8:30 AM, BRANCH 3.  

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw

  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Erick Jesus Monge in court with attorney Michael B. Plaisted.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for a motion hearing.  State not ready to proceed.  Defense withdraws request for a motion hearing, and would like to resolve the case.

Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  

AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2  IN THE AMENDED INFORMATION:

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.

AS TO COUNT 2 IN THE AMENDED INFORMATION:

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Case adjourned for sentencing on 10/29/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3. 

Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed.  aw

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Received and filed. 

Count 1:  Possession of cocaine, contrary to WI Stats sec. 961.41(3g)(c).  A unclassified misdemeanor.

Count 2:  Possession of narcotic drugs, contrary to WI Stats sec. 961.41(3g)(am), 939.50(3)(i).  A class I felony.
